children.text: I was traveling this morning to meet with a collaborator helping to audit and test the upcoming Credmark protocol and, fittingly enough, stepped off my plane to find trading volume well over $1M.
Notably, the largest transactions were made by multiSig Gnosis safes; MultiSigs indicate sophisticated investors like
high net-worth individuals
DAO’s, long-term, and institutional players
— which makes sense given all of the partnership activity and market discovery coming out of our research, which will be publicly available VERY soon.
And now, the jury is in: it’s desperately needed.
That’s why we’ve been talking to projects, individuals or organizations interested in controlling risk in DeFi. This of course includes our recently announced partnerships with
Cardax
and
Yield App

This past week we have spent a lot of time validating a risk report our team has produced for one of our newest partners (stay tuned to find out more, we’ll be putting out an official announcement next week). The report applies
crypto-analogs of TradFi standard risk models
to collateralized lending protocols.
We’re using existing tools to establish a quantitative base of input variables that can then be validated, improved upon, and added to until we have a comprehensive register of risk in DeFi.
Our research focuses on 4 areas:
Market Risk
, or the exposure to losses caused by changing prices of assets held by a protocol
Liquidity risk
, the potential for a lending protocol to owe more to depositors than assets they control
Operational Risk
, or quantifying the impact of a potential hack, and central authority
Profitability
, while not traditionally a risk metric, is a strong consideration in DeFi

By examining each of these factors in a qualitative manner, we are able to compare “apples to apples” between Lenders. This is the intellectual jumping off point for risk management; understanding these variables are necessary, but not sufficient to scaling a framework.
We are going to publicly announce our risk report in the coming week, but if you want an early look, we are teasing it in our
Discord
as part of our burgeoning Risk Library. Follow us on Twitter and Medium to hear more about what that is, and how it folds into our product in the days to come.
Happy DeFi-ing folks!
